intro: Klasea serratuloides subsp. serratuloides, commonly known as the narrowleaf klasea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in grassland or shrubland habitats. Its leaves are linear and serrated, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
